tagRef.name: Creature
tagRef.tooltip: Creature reference for swarm characters ONLY

stringid.name: Default Dialogue Effect ID
stringid.tooltip: gets applied if the vocalization has no dialogue effect id.

stringid.name: Default Dialogue Effect ID
stringid.tooltip: gets applied if the vocalization has no dialogue effect id.

int16.name: Rank
int16.tooltip: the rank of this character, helps us work out who in a squad should be a leader (0 is lowly, 32767 is highest)

enum16.name: Follower Positioning
enum16.tooltip: where should my followers try and position themselves when I am their leader?

float32.name: Maximum Leader Distance
float32.tooltip: don't let my combat range get outside this distance from my leader when in combat (if 0 then defaults to 4wu)

float32.name: Absolute Maximum Leader Distance
float32.tooltip: never select firing positions outside this range from the leader (if 0 then defaults to 8wu)

float32.name: Maximum Player Dialogue Distance
float32.tooltip: never play dialogue if all players are outside of this range (if 0 then defaults to 20wu)

float32.name: Scariness
float32.tooltip: the inherent scariness of the character

enum16.name: Highest Prop Class
enum16.tooltip: The prop class that this block is describing

option.name: Dead Enemy
option.tooltip: My only target is a dead enemy

option.name: Non-Attacking Enemy
option.tooltip: I am debilitated and the enemy is not attacking me

option.name: Disregarded Orphan
option.tooltip: Did not find my target and gave up searching

option.name: Inspected Orphan
option.tooltip: Checked last know position and didn't find target; still searching

option.name: Uninspected Orphan
option.tooltip: Can't see target, but have a good idea where they may be

option.name: Certain Orphan
option.tooltip: Can't see target, but know exactly where they are

option.name: Nearby Enemy
option.tooltip: I can see the target, and it's close

option.name: Potentially Dangerous Enemy
option.tooltip: Target is near and is facing me

option.name: Dangerous Enemy
option.tooltip: Target is facing my way and fighting

option.name: Attacking Enemy
option.tooltip: Target is aiming at me and shooting me

float32.name: Situational Danger
float32.tooltip: What should be the situational danger level for the prop class selected above

float32.name: Perceived Danger Increase Half-Life
float32.tooltip: How many seconds until it rises up to half between its current and target value

float32.name: Perceived Danger Decay Half-Life
float32.tooltip: How many seconds until it decays to half between its current and target values

float32.name: Normal Body Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum body vitality of our unit

float32.name: Normal Shield Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum shield vitality of our unit

float32.name: Legendary Body Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum body vitality of our unit (on legendary)

float32.name: Legendary Shield Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum shield vitality of our unit (on legendary)

float32.name: Body Recharge Fraction
float32.tooltip: fraction of body health that can be regained after damage

float32.name: Soft Ping Threshold (With Shields)
float32.tooltip: THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION

float32.name: Soft Ping Threshold (No Shields)
float32.tooltip: THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION

float32.name: Hard Ping Threshold (With Shields)
float32.tooltip: THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION

float32.name: Hard Ping Threshold (No Shields)
float32.tooltip: THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION

float32.name: Hard Ping Cooldown Time
float32.tooltip: minimum time before another hard ping can be triggered

float32.name: Body Recharge Delay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

float32.name: Body Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

float32.name: Shield Recharge Delay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

float32.name: Shield Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

float32.name: Extended Shield Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Amount of shield damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

float32.name: Extended Body Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Amount of body damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

float32.name: Suicide Radius
float32.tooltip: when I die and explode, I damage stuff within this distance of me.

tagRef.name: Resurrect Weapon
tagRef.tooltip: If I'm being automatically resurrected then I pull out a ...

float32.name: Maximum Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range of sight

float32.name: Reliable Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: reliable range of sight

float32.name: Maximum Peripheral Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range of peripheral vision

float32.name: Reliable Peripheral Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: reliable range of peripheral vision

float32.name: Minimum Peripheral Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: minimum range of peripheral vision (at peripheral vision angle)

float32.name: Minimum Reliable Peripheral Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: minimum reliable range of peripheral vision (at peripheral vision angle)

float32.name: Surprise Distance
float32.tooltip: If a new prop is acknowledged within the given distance, surprise is registered

degree.name: Focus Interior Angle
degree.tooltip: horizontal angle within which we see targets out to our maximum range

degree.name: Focus Exterior Angle
degree.tooltip: horizontal angle within which we see targets at a range in between maximum and maximum peripheral

degree.name: Peripheral Vision Angle
degree.tooltip: maximum horizontal angle within which we can see targets out of the corner of our eye up to maximum peripheral vision

float32.name: Hearing Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range at which sounds can be heard

float32.name: Notice Projectile Chance
float32.tooltip: random chance of noticing a dangerous enemy projectile (e.g. grenade)

float32.name: Notice Vehicle Chance
float32.tooltip: random chance of noticing a dangerous vehicle

float32.name: Perception Time
float32.tooltip: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy at optimal range

float32.name: Awareness Glance Level[0,1]
float32.tooltip: How aware of you while acknowledging an AI must be to glance at you

float32.name: Awareness Glance Delta
float32.tooltip: While acknowledging, the awareness delta at which an AI will glance at you

float32.name: Identify Hologram Chance
float32.tooltip: The chance that an AI identifies a unit is actually a hologram

rangef.name: Hologram Ignore Timer
rangef.tooltip: The time after which we will ignore the hologram once seen

float32.name: Hologram Ignore Timer Shot Penalty
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds taken off of the ignore timer each time the hologram is shot

float32.name: Camouflaged Enemy Visible Distance (Normal)
float32.tooltip: Distance below which the AI becomes aware of you even if you are camouflaged, normal difficulty

float32.name: Camouflaged Enemy Visible Distance (Legendary)
float32.tooltip: Distance below which the AI becomes aware of you even if you are camouflaged, lengendary difficulty

float32.name: Partial Invis Amount
float32.tooltip: this amount of active camouflage makes a target 'partially invisible'

float32.name: Partial Invis Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum vision distance for partially invisible targets. 0= unlimited

float32.name: Partial Invis Awareness Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multiplier on our awareness speed for partially invisible targets. 0= no change. Should be in (0, 1].

float32.name: Full Invis Amount
float32.tooltip: this amount of active camouflage makes a target 'fully invisible'

float32.name: Full Invis Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum vision distance for fully invisible targets. 0= unlimited

float32.name: Full Invis Awareness Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multiplier on our awareness speed for fully invisible targets. 0= no change. Should be in (0, 1].

float32.name: Partial Invis Amount
float32.tooltip: this amount of active camouflage makes a target 'partially invisible'

float32.name: Partial Invis Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum vision distance for partially invisible targets. 0= unlimited

float32.name: Partial Invis Awareness Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multiplier on our awareness speed for partially invisible targets. 0= no change. Should be in (0, 1].

float32.name: Full Invis Amount
float32.tooltip: this amount of active camouflage makes a target 'fully invisible'

float32.name: Full Invis Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum vision distance for fully invisible targets. 0= unlimited

float32.name: Full Invis Awareness Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multiplier on our awareness speed for fully invisible targets. 0= no change. Should be in (0, 1].

float32.name: Player Preference
float32.tooltip: How interested in the player I am on a scale of 0-1

degree2.name: Maximum Aiming Deviation
degree2.tooltip: how far we can turn our weapon

degree2.name: Maximum Looking Deviation
degree2.tooltip: how far we can turn our head

degree.name: Noncombat Look Delta Left
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when not in combat

degree.name: Noncombat Look Delta Right
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when not in combat

degree.name: Combat Look Delta Left
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when in combat

degree.name: Combat Look Delta Right
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when in combat

rangef.name: Noncombat Idle Looking
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change look around randomly when not in combat

rangef.name: Noncombat Idle Aiming
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when not in combat

rangef.name: Combat Idle Looking
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change look around randomly when searching or in combat

rangef.name: Combat Idle Aiming
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when searching or in combat

tagblock.name: Movement Properties
tagblock.comment: These values govern how we should avoid danger zones (like grenades and vehicles). If their sum is less than 1 then neither action will occur and instead we'll just try to walk out of the way with that remaining probability.

float32.name: Armor Lock Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance the AI will use their armor lock equipment, assuming they have it

float32.name: Grenade Stuck Armor Lock Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance the AI will use their armor lock equipment if they have been stuck with a grenade, assuming they have it

float32.name: Armor Lock Safety Duration
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds we will stay in armor lock for after danger has passed (default 1 second)

float32.name: Armor Lock Maximum Duration
float32.tooltip: The longest we will stay in armor lock for regardless of danger (default 5 seconds)

float32.name: Armor Lock Cooldown
float32.tooltip: We won't go into armor lock again for this many seconds (default 0 seconds)

float32.name: Maximum Leap Height
float32.tooltip: .How high can a crate be for this unit to leap it.

float32.name: Leap Proximity Fraction
float32.tooltip: How close to the obstacle should the actor be before leaping 1- too close, 0- as soon as he becomes aware of it

float32.name: Avoidance Volume Turn Penalty Distance
float32.tooltip: The maximum distance penalty applied to an avoidance volume search path if we're facing away from the path. 1000 wu good for space, 5 wu good for ground.

int32.name: Minimum Movement Ticks
int32.tooltip: We will move at least this long in a single direction when starting movement

float32.name: Minimum Movement Ticks Reset Angle
float32.tooltip: If the character changes movement direction by more than this angle, he will have to move for at least minimum movement ticks until he can change his mind.

tagblock.name: Change Direction Pause
tagblock.comment: These values tell the actor to remain stationary for the specified number of ticks if he changes his direction of movement by at least 'change angle'. Specifying an angle of 0 means pause this much every time you get to your destination.

float32.name: Maximum Throttle
float32.tooltip: The character will never throttle beyond this value

float32.name: Minimum Throttle
float32.tooltip: The character will not throttle below this value

enum16.name: Combat Status
enum16.tooltip: When combat status is bigger or equal to this combat status, use the throttle settings below.

float32.name: Distance
float32.tooltip: If AI needs to move at greater or equal to this distance, they will move at the given throttle

float32.name: Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: Throttle scale between minimum and maximum throttle

float32.name: Minimum Juke Throttle
float32.tooltip: The character will consider juking at this throttle and above

degree.name: Minimum Direction Change Juke Angle
degree.tooltip: If we change movement direction by more this angle, we will attempt a juke

float32.name: Non Direction Change Juke Probability
float32.tooltip: Probability to do a juke for a given tick, even if you are not planning to change direction (and provided you have not already performed a juke within the timeout time

float32.name: Non Direction Change Juke Timeout
float32.tooltip: After you do a change or no change of direction juke, you cannot perform a NON directional change juke for at least this many seconds. Direction change jukes will still happen

int32.name: Minimum Post Juke Movement Ticks
int32.tooltip: How many ticks should the actor keep moving after a juke? This may lower juke frequency.

float32.name: Stationary Turn Radius
float32.tooltip: If this actor translates during turn animations, enter a radius that encloses the translation.

float32.name: Localized Move Distance
float32.tooltip: Distance to move as per the move_localized firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu)

rangef.name: Move Distance
rangef.tooltip: Distance to move as per the move_distance firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu for min, 10wu for max)

rangef.name: Vehicle Move Distance
rangef.tooltip: Distance to move as per the vehicle_move_distance firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu for min, 10wu for max)

float32.name: Turn And Run Distance From Target
float32.tooltip: Actor will face away from his target and run to his destination if his target at a larger distance than this

float32.name: Turn And Run Distance To Destination
float32.tooltip: Firing point must be at least this distance away from the actor for him to consider turning and running to it

float32.name: Follow Unit Buffer Distance
float32.tooltip: When following a unit, such as the player, this is the additional buffer outside of the task follow radius that we are allowed to position ourselves before full firing position avoidance kicks in

int16.name: Scatter Killed Count
int16.tooltip: After the given number of deaths, the swarm scatters

float32.name: Scatter Radius
float32.tooltip: the distance from the target that the swarm scatters

float32.name: Scatter Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time to remain scattered

rangef.name: Infection Time
rangef.tooltip: how long the infection form and its victim will wrestle before the point of no return

float32.name: Perlin Offset Scale
float32.tooltip: amount of randomness added to creature's throttle

rangef.name: Offset Period
rangef.tooltip: how fast the creature changes random offset to throttle

float32.name: Perlin Idle Movement Threshold
float32.tooltip: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

float32.name: Perlin Combat Movement Threshold
float32.tooltip: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

float32.name: Stuck Time
float32.tooltip: how long we have to move (stuck distance) before we get deleted

float32.name: Stuck Distance
float32.tooltip: how far we have to move in (stuck time) to not get deleted

tagblock.name: Firing Point Evaluator Properties
tagblock.comment: If you want to screw the AI up, here's a great place to start. Please try not to.

tagblock.name: Evaluators
tagblock.comment: The firing point evaluation properties for a single evaluator. Treat with great care and respect.

option.name: Attack Same Frame Of Reference&Attack Same Frame Of Reference (Pre)
Move Into Danger Zone&Move Into Danger Zone (Pre)
Threat Axis Spring Reject&Threat Axis Spring Reject (Pre)
Too Far From Leader&Too Far From Leader (Pre)
Attack Visible Los Optional&Attack Visible Los Optional (Post)

rangef.name: Ready Time Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Character will pause for given time before engaging threat

rangef.name: Reposition Bounds
rangef.tooltip: How long should I remain at a firing position before moving? (0 values will use the default values of 6 and 7 seconds)

float32.name: Crouch Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger rises above the threshold, the actor crouches

float32.name: Stand Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger drops below this threshold, the actor can stand again.

float32.name: Fight Danger Move Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger goes above given level, this actor switches firing positions

range16.name: Fight Danger Move Threshold Cooldown
range16.tooltip: Wait at least this many ticks before relocating due to danger

float32.name: Fight Flank Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance of flanking when fighting someone who isn't paying attention to me

tagRef.name: Override Grenade Projectile
tagRef.tooltip: when I throw a grenade, forget what type I officially have

rangef.name: Throw Distance
rangef.tooltip: Targets outside this range will not be attacked with a throw

float32.name: Throw Search Radius
float32.tooltip: How far does actor search for throwable items

degree.name: Throw Search Angle
degree.tooltip: Angle (degrees) that the actor searches for throwable items (from his facing direction)

float32.name: Maximum Throw Force
float32.tooltip: Maximum throw force - it will not be used all the time

float32.name: Throw Target Point Offset
float32.tooltip: Vertical offset from target position on ground where throw is aimed

rangef.name: Throw Delay
rangef.tooltip: Delay until another throw is attempted

rangef.name: Default Combat Range
rangef.tooltip: If we are not holding a weapon, or we don't know how to use our weapon, use these bounds on my combat range

rangef.name: Default Firing Range
rangef.tooltip: If we don't know how to use our weapon, use these bounds on my firing range

float32.name: Melee Chance
float32.tooltip: chance of initiating a melee within a 1 second period

float32.name: Melee Attack Timeout
float32.tooltip: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

float32.name: Melee Attack Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: don't attempt again before given time since last melee

float32.name: Melee Armor Lock Delay
float32.tooltip: don't attempt a melee on a recently armor locked target for this many seconds

float32.name: Melee Leap Ballistic
float32.tooltip: min ballistic fraction

float32.name: Melee Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: time between melee leaps

float32.name: Melee Leap Prediction Time
float32.tooltip: how far ahead (seconds) do we look at target for translational prediction?

rangef.name: Shield-Down Berserk Chance
rangef.tooltip: lower bound is chance to berserk at max range, upper bound is chance to berserk at min range, requires shield depleted berserk impulse

float32.name: Friendly Killed Maximum Berserk Distance
float32.tooltip: The max range at which we will go berserk if we see a friendly AI of the same type (brute, etc) get killed

float32.name: Peer Killed Berserk Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance that we will go berserk if we see a friendly AI of the same type (brute, etc) with the same or lower standing get killed

float32.name: Leader Killed Berserk Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance that we will go berserk if we see a friendly AI of the same type (brute, etc) with higher standing get killed

float32.name: Beserk Cooldown
float32.tooltip: Time that I will stay in beserk after losing my target, and then revert back to normal

float32.name: Proximity Berserk Range
float32.tooltip: If our target is closer than this distance, and not (in a vehicle/larger size than us/using a melee weapon), we will berserk. If our target is further than this distance, we will stop berserking. Set to 0 to disable proximity berserking.

float32.name: Proximity Berserk Outside FP Range
float32.tooltip: We will never go more than this far outside our firing point areas when proximity-berserking. 0= no limit.

float32.name: Proximity Berserk Chance
float32.tooltip: If we have a target close enough to berserk, this is the chance that we will do so. If chance fails, we will try again after timeout.

float32.name: Proximity Berserk Timeout
float32.tooltip: We will not proximity-berserk unless it has been at least this long since we last stopped berserking. 0= no timeout.

float32.name: Broken Kamikaze Chance
float32.tooltip: Probability that I will run the kamikaze behaviour when my leader dies.

float32.name: Perimeter Range
float32.tooltip: How far we will melee charge outside our firing points before starting perimeter (defaults to 5wu)

float32.name: Perimeter Range Close
float32.tooltip: How far we will melee charge outside our firing points before starting perimeter when the target is close to me (within 3wu) (defaults to 9wu)

float32.name: Perimeter Damage Timeout
float32.tooltip: How long will we take damage from our target before either seeking cover or berserking (defaults to 3secs)

tagblock.name: Difficulty Limits
tagblock.comment: Per difficulty values to limit the number of guys in particular behaviours

int16.name: Maximum Kamikaze Count
int16.tooltip: How many guys in a single clump can be kamikazing at one time

int16.name: Maximum Berserk Count
int16.tooltip: How many guys in a single clump can be berserking at one time

int16.name: Minimum Berserk Count
int16.tooltip: We'd like at least this number of guys in a single clump can be berserking at one time (primarily combat forms)

plugin.comment: Danger values can be found in the ai-globals section of the globals tag.

float32.name: Evasion Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: Consider evading when immediate danger surpasses threshold

float32.name: Evasion Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: Wait at least this delay between evasions

float32.name: Evasion Chance
float32.tooltip: If danger is above threshold, the chance that we will evade. Expressed as chance of evading within a 1 second time period

float32.name: Evasion Proximity Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target is within given proximity, possibly evade

float32.name: Dive Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance of retreating (fleeing) after danger avoidance dive

tagblock.name: Cover Properties

bit.name: Unassailable Cover Ends ONLY When Target Assailable

rangef.name: Hide Behind Cover Time
rangef.tooltip: how long we stay behind cover after seeking cover

tagblock.comment: The following fields dictate how hologram equipment is used by AI in cover.

rangef.name: Hologram Cover Wait Time
rangef.tooltip: how long we wait in cover before using the hologram

float32.name: Hologram Cooldown Delay
float32.tooltip: Amount of time I will wait before trying to use hologram equipment again (0 value defaults to 5 seconds)

tagblock.comment: The following fields dictate the conditions under which we will go into cover.

float32.name: Cover Shield Fraction
float32.tooltip: Only cover when shield falls below this level

float32.name: Cover Vitality Threshold
float32.tooltip: Only cover when vitality falls below this level

float32.name: Cover Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: Danger must be this high to cover.

float32.name: Minimum Defensive Distance From Target
float32.tooltip: How far from the target should we switch from aggresive to defensive covering (0 always defensive, big number always offensive)

float32.name: Minimum Defensive Distance From Cover
float32.tooltip: If our cover point is less than this distance, we will never consider defensive covering

float32.name: Always Defensive Scary Threshold
float32.tooltip: If the target has scarines bigger or equal to this, we will always cover defensively

float32.name: Cover Check Delay
float32.tooltip: Amount of time I will wait before trying again after covering (0 value defaults to 2 seconds)

float32.name: Cover Pinned Down Check Delay
float32.tooltip: Amount of time I will wait before issuing a pinned down message (0 value defaults to 2 seconds)

float32.name: Emerge From Cover When Shield Fraction Reaches Threshold
float32.tooltip: Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold

float32.name: Proximity Self-Preserve
float32.tooltip: Triggers self-preservation when target within this distance (assuming proximity_self_preserve_impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Proximity Melee Distance
float32.tooltip: When self preserving from a target less than given distance, causes melee attack (assuming proximity_melee_impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Unreachable Enemy Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger from an unreachable enemy surpasses threshold, actor cover (assuming unreachable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Unassailable Enemy Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When target is unassailable, and danger goes over this value - cover (assuming unassailable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Scary Target Threshold
float32.tooltip: When target is aware of me and surpasses the given scariness, self-preserve (assuming scary_target_cover_impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Vitality Fraction Shield Equipment
float32.tooltip: Fraction of vitality below which an equipped shield equipment (instant cover/bubbleshield) will be activated (once damage has died down, and assuming shield_equipment_impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Recent Damage Shield Equipment
float32.tooltip: Must have less than this amount of recent body damage before we can deploy our equipped shield equipment.

float32.name: Shield Threshold
float32.tooltip: When shield vitality drops below given amount, retreat is triggered by low_shield_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Scary Target Threshold
float32.tooltip: When confronting an enemy of over the given scariness, retreat is triggered by scary_target_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When perceived danger rises above the given threshold, retreat is triggered by danger_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Proximity Threshold
float32.tooltip: When enemy closer than given threshold, retreat is triggered by proximity_retreat_impulse

rangef.name: Forced Cower Time Bounds
rangef.tooltip: actor cowers for at least the given amount of time

rangef.name: Cower Timeout Bounds
rangef.tooltip: actor times out of cower after the given amount of time

float32.name: Proximity Ambush Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target reaches is within the given proximity, an ambush is triggered by the proximity ambush impulse

float32.name: Awareness Ambush Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target is less than threshold (0-1) aware of me, an ambush is triggered by the vulnerable enemy ambush impulse

float32.name: Leader Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If leader-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when our leader dies within 4 world units of us

float32.name: Peer Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when one of our peers (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

float32.name: Second Peer Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when a second peer (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

float32.name: Flee Timeout
float32.tooltip: Flee for no longer than this time (if there is no cover, then we will keep fleeing indefinitely). Value of 0 means 'no timeout'

degree.name: Zig-Zag Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle from the intended destination direction that a zig-zag will cause

float32.name: Zig-Zag Period
float32.tooltip: How long it takes to zig left and then zag right.

float32.name: Retreat Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: The likelihood of throwing down a grenade to cover our retreat

tagRef.name: Backup Weapon
tagRef.tooltip: If I want to flee and I don't have flee animations with my current weapon, throw it away and try a ...

tagblock.name: Search Properties

float32.name: Search Distance
float32.tooltip: Maximum distance away from our firing positions that we are happy to search (0 value will default to 3wu). Does not affect vehicle search distance (see maxd if you want that value too).

rangef.name: Uncover Distance Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Distance of uncover point from target. Hard lower limit, soft upper limit.

tagblock.comment: Orphan offset: Offset from the orphan pos along the orphan hint vector that we will investigate to. Positive value means we are predicting where the target is going, negative value means that we would like to stand back a bit and look along the orphan vector.

float32.name: Orphan Offset
float32.tooltip: (0 value will default to 1.8wu)

float32.name: Minimum Offset
float32.tooltip: Minimum offset from the target point to investigate, otherwise we just use the target point itself. Not entirely sure about the justification for this one...

float32.name: Performance Cool-Down Time
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds that must elapse before an actor will consider a search-performance again

rangef.name: Maximum Presearch Time
rangef.tooltip: Presearch turns off after the given time

float32.name: Maximum Suppress Time
float32.tooltip: Suppress turns off after the given time (0 defaults to 8 seconds)

rangef.name: Idle Pose Delay Time
rangef.tooltip: time range for delays between idle poses

rangef.name: Wander Delay Time
rangef.tooltip: time to pause at a point while wandering

tagblock.name: Vocalization Properties
tagblock.comment: For vocalization with priority < react, multiplies the skip fraction in the dialogue globals tag. For priorities > react, multiplies the vocalization WEIGHT (i.e. the desire of that character to vocalize RELATIVE to other characters in the scene). Thus if you hurt the arbiter, say, he's still going to yell at you, no matter what, and if you kill somebody and nobody else is there to witness it, he will yell at you. As always, 0 means speak normally, 1 means skip everything (don't say shit)

float32.name: Look Comment Time
float32.tooltip: How long does the player look at an AI before the AI responds?

float32.name: Look Long Comment Time
float32.tooltip: How long does the player look at the AI before he responds with his 'long look' comment?

float32.name: Maximum Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum distance from entry point that we will consider boarding

float32.name: Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: give up trying to get in boarding seat if entry point is further away than this

float32.name: Maximum Speed
float32.tooltip: maximum speed at which we will consider boarding

float32.name: Board Time
float32.tooltip: maximum time we will melee board for

rangef.name: Boarding Timeout
rangef.tooltip: The amount of time after boarding before we'll consider boarding again

float32.name: Kungfu Override Distance
float32.tooltip: If the player is within this distance, open fire, even if your task is kungfu-fight disallowed

float32.name: Kungfu Cover Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: If you are kungfu disallowed and your danger is above this level, take cover

rangef.name: Open Time
rangef.tooltip: How long we should open for

float32.name: Closed Minimum Time
float32.tooltip: How long we must stay closed for before opening or peeking again

float32.name: Close Danger Level
float32.tooltip: Force close at this danger level

float32.name: Open Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of opening per second

float32.name: Peek Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of peeking per second

rangef.name: Open Time
rangef.tooltip: How long we should open for

float32.name: Closed Minimum Time
float32.tooltip: How long we must stay closed for before opening or peeking again

float32.name: Close Danger Level
float32.tooltip: Force close at this danger level

float32.name: Open Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of opening per second

float32.name: Peek Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of peeking per second

rangef.name: Open Time
rangef.tooltip: How long we should open for

float32.name: Closed Minimum Time
float32.tooltip: How long we must stay closed for before opening or peeking again

float32.name: Close Danger Level
float32.tooltip: Force close at this danger level

float32.name: Open Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of opening per second

float32.name: Peek Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of peeking per second

rangef.name: Open Time
rangef.tooltip: How long we should open for

float32.name: Closed Minimum Time
float32.tooltip: How long we must stay closed for before opening or peeking again

float32.name: Close Danger Level
float32.tooltip: Force close at this danger level

float32.name: Open Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of opening per second

float32.name: Peek Chance
float32.tooltip: What chance we have of peeking per second

float32.name: Surge Time
float32.tooltip: length of time for which the guardian surges

float32.name: Surge Delay Time
float32.tooltip: minimum enforced delay between surges

float32.name: Proximity Surge Distance
float32.tooltip: surge when our target gets closer than this to me (0 value defaults to 2wu)

float32.name: Phase Time
float32.tooltip: length of time it takes the guardian to get to its phase destination

float32.name: Current Position Distance
float32.tooltip: Minimum distance that I will consider phasing

float32.name: Target Position Distance
float32.tooltip: Minimum distance from my target that I will phase to

float32.name: Berserk Distance
float32.tooltip: distance at which combatform will be forced into berserk

float32.name: Berserk Chance
float32.tooltip: chance of berserking this second

tagblock.name: Engineer Properties

float32.name: Death Height
float32.tooltip: try and rise this amount before dying

float32.name: Death Rise Time
float32.tooltip: spend this time rising

float32.name: Death Detonation Time
float32.tooltip: spend this time detonating

float32.name: Shield Boost Radius Maximum
float32.tooltip: Boost the shields of allies within this radius during combat

float32.name: Shield Boost Period
float32.tooltip: Time between shield boost pings from the engineer

stringid.name: Shield Boost Damage Section Name
stringid.tooltip: The name of the damage section which will be activated by the engineer shield boost

tagblock.comment: If shield vitality AND body vitality fall below the thresholds below, detonate

float32.name: Proximity Radius
float32.tooltip: if target enters within this radius, either detonate or deploy equipment

float32.name: Proximity Detonation Chance
float32.tooltip: chance of detonating if target enters the drain radius radius

tagRef.name: Proximity Equipment
tagRef.tooltip: if target enters radius and detonation is not chosen, deploy this equipment.

float32.name: Stop Distance
float32.tooltip: distance from object at which to stop and turn on the inspection light

rangef.name: Inspect Time
rangef.tooltip: time which we should inspect each object for

rangef.name: Search Range
rangef.tooltip: range in which we should search for objects to inspect

rangef.name: Fighting Distance
rangef.tooltip: When target outside this range, the scarab will back up or chase to stay within range

rangef.name: Anticipated Aim Radius
rangef.tooltip: When within these bounds distance from the target, we blend in our anticipated facing vector

rangef.name: Snap Forward Angle
rangef.tooltip: When moving forward within this dot of our desired facing, just move forward

tagblock.name: Weapons Properties

bit.name: Force Aim From Barrel Position
bit.tooltip: use only for weapons with really, really long barrels (bfg), do NOT use for rotating turret weapons (warthog, falcon, etc)

float32.name: Maximum Firing Range
float32.tooltip: we can only fire our weapon at targets within this distance

float32.name: Minimum Firing Range
float32.tooltip: weapon will not be fired at target closer than given distance

float32.name: Bombardment Range
float32.tooltip: we offset our burst targets randomly by this range when firing at non-visible enemies (zero = never)

float32.name: Maximum Special Target Distance
float32.tooltip: Specific target regions on a vehicle or unit will be fired upon only under the given distance

rangef.name: Ballistic Firing Bounds
rangef.tooltip: At the min range, the min ballistic fraction is used, at the max, the max ballistic fraction is used

rangef.name: Ballistic Fraction Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = high, slow, 1 = low, fast

vector3.name: Custom Stand Gun Offset
vector3.tooltip: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

vector3.name: Custom Crouch Gun Offset
vector3.tooltip: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

enum16.name: Special-Fire Mode
enum16.tooltip: the type of special weapon fire that we can use

enum16.name: Special-Fire Situation
enum16.tooltip: when we will decide to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special-Fire Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special-Fire Delay
float32.tooltip: how long we must wait between uses of our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special Damage Modifier
float32.tooltip: damage modifier for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal damage modifier. zero = no change)

degree.name: Special Projectile Error
degree.tooltip: projectile error angle for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal error)

rangef.name: Drop Weapon Loaded
rangef.tooltip: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5)

range16.name: Drop Weapon Ammo
range16.tooltip: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons)

tagblock.comment: Parameters control how accuracy changes over the duration of a series of bursts Accuracy is an analog value between 0 and 1. At zero, the parameters of the first firing-pattern block is used. At 1, the parameters in the second block is used. In between, all the values are linearly interpolated

rangef.name: Normal Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at normal difficulty

float32.name: Normal Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

rangef.name: Heroic Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at heroic difficulty

float32.name: Heroic Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

rangef.name: Legendary Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at legendary difficulty

float32.name: Legendary Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

tagblock.name: Firing Patterns

float32.name: Rate Of Fire
float32.tooltip: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

float32.name: Target Tracking
float32.tooltip: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

float32.name: Target Leading
float32.tooltip: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

tagblock.comment:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

float32.name: Burst Origin Radius
float32.tooltip: how far away from the target the starting point is

degree.name: Burst Origin Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

rangef.name: Burst Return Length
rangef.tooltip: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

degree.name: Burst Return Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

rangef.name: Burst Duration
rangef.tooltip: how long each burst we fire is

rangef.name: Burst Separation
rangef.tooltip: how long we wait between bursts

float32.name: Weapon Damage Modifier
float32.tooltip: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

degree.name: Projectile Error
degree.tooltip: error added to every projectile we fire

degree.name: Burst Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

degree.name: Maximum Error Angle
degree.tooltip: cap on the maximum angle by which we will miss target (restriction on burst origin radius

enum16.name: Grenade Type
enum16.tooltip: type of grenades that we throw

int16.name: Minimum Enemy Count
int16.tooltip: how many enemies must be within the radius of the grenade before we will consider throwing there

float32.name: Enemy Radius
float32.tooltip: we consider enemies within this radius when determining where to throw

float32.name: Grenade Ideal Velocity
float32.tooltip: how fast we LIKE to throw our grenades

float32.name: Grenade Velocity
float32.tooltip: the fastest we can possibly throw our grenades

rangef.name: Grenade Ranges
rangef.tooltip: ranges within which we will consider throwing a grenade

float32.name: Collateral Damage Radius
float32.tooltip: we won't throw if there are friendlies around our target within this range

float32.name: Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade in one second

float32.name: Grenade Throw Delay
float32.tooltip: How long we have to wait after throwing a grenade before we can throw another one

float32.name: Grenade Uncover Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade to flush out a target in one second

float32.name: Anti-Vehicle Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade against a vehicle

range16.name: Grenade Count
range16.tooltip: number of grenades that we start with

float32.name: Dont Drop Grenades Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are not to drop any grenades when we die, even if we still have some

float32.name: Lookahead Time
float32.tooltip: How much in the future should we estimate a collision (affects collision ray length)

float32.name: Roll Change Magnitude
float32.tooltip: How fast to control the roll avoidance

float32.name: Roll Decay Multiplier
float32.tooltip: How fast roll goes back to 0- 1 means never, 0 means instantaneously

float32.name: Throttle Grace Period
float32.tooltip: How long after a collision should the vehicle keep moving at max throttle

float32.name: Minimum Throttle
float32.tooltip: Minimum throttle that the avoidance can slow down to

float32.name: Avoidance Volume Turn Penalty Distance
float32.tooltip: The maximum distance penalty applied to an avoidance volume search path if we're facing away from the path. 1000 wu good for space, 5 wu good for ground.

float32.name: Hover Deceleration Distance
float32.tooltip: Distance defines a box outside of which we clamp perturbation. Value of zero causes fallback to run.

float32.name: Hover Offset Distance
float32.tooltip: The max radius of the XZ anchor perturbation. Value of zero causes fallback to run.

float32.name: Hover Allow Perturbation Speed
float32.tooltip: The speed the vehicle must be below for it to start running hover perturbation (default=0.4).

float32.name: Hover Random x-Axis Period
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds for the x component of the anchor perturbation to repeat itself (default=10).

float32.name: Hover Random y-Axis Period
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds for the y component of the anchor perturbation to repeat itself (default=7).

float32.name: Hover Random z-Axis Period
float32.tooltip: The number of seconds for the z component of the anchor perturbation to repeat itself (default=5).

float32.name: Hover Random Radius
float32.tooltip: The radius of the anchor perturbation. (default=0)

float32.name: Hover Anchor Approach Speed Limit
float32.tooltip: If we're traveling faster than this amount toward the anchor inside the max throttle distance, we drop throttle to the min. (default=0.2)

rangef.name: Hover Anchor Throttle Scale Distance
rangef.tooltip: The distance from the anchor at which the min and max throttle scale occur. (default=[0.25, 2.0])

rangef.name: Hover Anchor xy-Throttle Scale
rangef.tooltip: The xy-throttle scale at the min and max throttle scale distances. (default=[0.0, 0.2])

rangef.name: Hover Anchor z-Throttle Scale
rangef.tooltip: The z-throttle scale at the min and max throttle scale distances. (default=[1.0, 1.0])

float32.name: Hover Throttle Minimum z
float32.tooltip: The minimum the z component of throttle is allowed to be (default=0.2)

float32.name: AI Destination Radius
float32.tooltip: Distance within which goal is considered reached

float32.name: AI Deceleration Distance
float32.tooltip: Distance from goal at which AI starts to decelerate

float32.name: AI Turning Radius
float32.tooltip: Idealized average turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

float32.name: AI Inner Turning Radius
float32.tooltip: Idealized minimum turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

float32.name: AI Ideal Turning Radius
float32.tooltip: Ideal turning radius for rounding turns (barring obstacles, etc.)

float32.name: AI Maximum Steering Angle
float32.tooltip: Maximum steering angle from forward (ultimately controls turning speed)

float32.name: AI Maximum Steering Delta
float32.tooltip: Maximum delta in steering angle from one tick to the next (ultimately controls turn acceleration)

ranged.name: Ai Oversteering Bounds
ranged.tooltip: Angle to goal at which AI will oversteer

float32.name: AI Sideslip Distance
float32.tooltip: Distance within which Ai will strafe to target (as opposed to turning)

float32.name: AI Avoidance Distance
float32.tooltip: Look-ahead distance for obstacle avoidance

float32.name: AI Minimum Urgency
float32.tooltip: The minimum urgency with which a turn can be made (urgency = percent of maximum steering delta)

degree.name: Destination Behind Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle from facing that is considered to be behind us (we do the ugly floaty slidey turn to things behind us)

float32.name: Skid Scale
float32.tooltip: When approaching a corner at speed, we may want to skid around that corner, by turning slightly too early. This is (roughly) how many seconds ahead we should start turning.

float32.name: AI Reverse Throttle Maximum
float32.tooltip: If zero, default to ai throttle maximum

float32.name: AI Goal Min Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on throttle when within 'ai deceleration distance' of goal (0...1)

float32.name: AI Turn Min Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: Scale on throttle due to nearness to a turn (0...1)

float32.name: AI Direction Min Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: Scale on throttle due to facing away from intended direction (0...1)

float32.name: AI Skid Min Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: Scale on throttle due to skidding (0...1)

degree.name: Skid Attentuation Maximum Angle
degree.tooltip: Maximise min throttle at this deviation of angles from current movement

float32.name: AI Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: The maximum allowable change in throttle between ticks

float32.name: AI Throttle Blend
float32.tooltip: The degree of throttle blending between one tick and the next (0 = no blending)

float32.name: Theoretical Maximum Speed
float32.tooltip: About how fast I can go.

float32.name: Error Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the difference between desired and actual speed, applied to throttle

float32.name: AI Charge Tight Angle Distance
float32.tooltip: The distance at which the tight angle criterion is used for deciding to vehicle charge

float32.name: AI Charge Tight Angle
float32.tooltip: Angle cosine within which the target must be when target is closer than tight angle distance in order to charge

float32.name: AI Charge Repeat Timeout
float32.tooltip: Time delay between vehicle charges

float32.name: AI Charge Look-Ahead Time
float32.tooltip: In deciding when to abort vehicle charge, look ahead these many seconds to predict time of contact

float32.name: AI Charge Consider Distance
float32.tooltip: Consider charging the target when it is within this range (0 = infinite distance)

float32.name: AI Charge Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: Abort the charge when the target get more than this far away (0 = never abort)

float32.name: AI Charge Armor Locked Target Chance
float32.tooltip: Probability that we decide to charge a target even if they are armor locked

float32.name: Ai Cover Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Trigger a cover when recent damage is above given threshold (damage_vehicle_cover impulse)

float32.name: Ai Cover Shield Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Trigger a cover when recent shied damage is above given threshold (flying_cover behavior)

float32.name: Ai Cover Min Distance
float32.tooltip: When executing vehicle-cover, minimum distance from the target to flee to

float32.name: Ai Cover Time
float32.tooltip: How long to stay away from the target

float32.name: Ai Cover Min Boost Distance
float32.tooltip: Boosting allowed when distance to cover destination is greater then this.

float32.name: Turtling Recent Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: If vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling is initiated if 'recent damage' surpasses the given threshold

float32.name: Turtling Min Time
float32.tooltip: If the vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling occurs for at least the given time

float32.name: Turtling Timeout
float32.tooltip: The turtled state times out after the given number of seconds

int16.name: Maximum Vehicle Charge
int16.tooltip: max number of this type of vehicle in a task who can vehicle charge at once

int16.name: Minimum Vehicle Charge
int16.tooltip: min number of this type of vehicle in a task who can vehicle charge at once (soft limit, just a desired number)

tagblock.name: Flying Movement Properties
tagblock.comment: Think of this as firing point evaluation; how much do we want to weight each of the various vectors affecting our movement in space.

float32.name: Facing
float32.tooltip: How much our current movement vector affects our new vector selection.

float32.name: Perturbation
float32.tooltip: How much random deviation is applied to our vector selection.

float32.name: Volume Avoidance
float32.tooltip: How strongly we avoid our containing volume.

float32.name: Volume Perturbation
float32.tooltip: How strongly we are randomly perturbed by our containing volume.

float32.name: Volume Cover
float32.tooltip: How strongly are we attracted toward cover points.

float32.name: Flocking
float32.tooltip: How much of a tendancy to flock we have.

float32.name: Target
float32.tooltip: The weight of our movement towards our current target.

float32.name: Target Tail
float32.tooltip: The weight of our movement intended to keep our target in our tail.

rangef.name: Area Reselect Time
rangef.tooltip: The time bounds on how long we should stay in an area before moving to another area.

rangef.name: Idle Time
rangef.tooltip: How long before reselecting a destination while idling.

rangef.name: Unsafe Cover Reselect Time
rangef.tooltip: How long after being exposed in cover before we reselect new cover.

rangef.name: Cover Heading Reselect Time
rangef.tooltip: The frequency at which we pick a new cover point on our current piece of cover.

float32.name: Maximum Cover Search Distance
float32.tooltip: The farthest from ourselves that we will search for cover.

float32.name: Maximum Cover Impulse Distance
float32.tooltip: The farthest our target can be from us when decided if we should go to cover.

rangef.name: Spline Cooldown Time
rangef.tooltip: The number of seconds we wait after traveling a spline to travel a spline again.

float32.name: Volume Influence Distance
float32.tooltip: How far our volume influences our movement

float32.name: Volume Perturbation Phase
float32.tooltip: What is the frequency of oscillation of our volume perturbation vector

float32.name: Volume Bounding Distance
float32.tooltip: How far we are allowed outside our volume before we started being forced to return (must be >= 0)

float32.name: Volume Approach Distance
float32.tooltip: If our target is this close to our containing volume, then start attacking him

float32.name: Volume Break Off Distance
float32.tooltip: While attacking our target, if we get this far outside our containing volume, break off the attack and return home

float32.name: Minimum Approach Distance
float32.tooltip: When this close to our target we will drop into the evade behaviour instead

rangef.name: Collision Avoidance Range
rangef.tooltip: Zero collision avoidance at the high distance, Max avoidance at the low distance.

rangef.name: Evade Time
rangef.tooltip: Bounds on how long we should evade for

float32.name: Evade Body Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: The recent body damage we should sustain before trying to evade.

float32.name: Evade Shield Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: The recent shield damage we should sustain before trying to evade.

float32.name: Bogey Retreat Time
float32.tooltip: How long we tolerate a bogey in our six, before we retreat back to our area.

float32.name: Bogey Retreat Distance
float32.tooltip: How close a bogey has to be before we'll even consider retreating.

rangef.name: Flock Radius
rangef.tooltip: Distance controls for flocking

degree.name: Forward Follow Angle
degree.tooltip: How close we must be facing another friend to consider following him during flocking.

degree.name: Behind Follow Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle of the 'cone' behind a friend who I am interested in following that I must be in to consider him during flocking.

float32.name: Minimum Tailing Time
float32.tooltip: The minimum amount of time we can be tailing

rangef.name: Tailing Radius
rangef.tooltip: Distance controls for tailing

degree.name: Tailing Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle of the 'cone' behind a foe who I am interested in tailing after approaching.

float32.name: Volume Strafe Distance
float32.tooltip: If our target is this close to our containing volume, then start strafing him

float32.name: Strafe Minimum Distance
float32.tooltip: I need to be at least this far away from my target to consider strafing him (2D)

float32.name: Strafe Above Distance
float32.tooltip: How high above our target we will aim for when strafing

float32.name: Strafe Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: If I get this close to my target, stop strafing and retreat for a bit (2D)

float32.name: Strafe Timeout
float32.tooltip: How long we go between strafes

degree.name: Maximum Descend Angle
degree.tooltip: The maximum angle at which we can descend.

degree.name: Maximum Ascend Angle
degree.tooltip: The maximum angle at which we can ascend.

degree.name: Shooting Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle of the shooting cone along the vehicle facing.

float32.name: Missile Dodge Change
float32.tooltip: The chance that an AI will dodge incoming missiles.

float32.name: Ideal Missile Dodge Distance
float32.tooltip: The ideal distance a trick should take you away from danger.

float32.name: Distance Damage Outer Radius
float32.tooltip: Considered damaging-outside-range when you START firing from outside this distance

float32.name: Distance Damage Inner Radius
float32.tooltip: Considered damaging-outside-range when you CONTINUE firing from outside this distance

float32.name: Distance Damage Time
float32.tooltip: Damaging tank guy from outside-range for this long causes a morph

float32.name: Distance Damage Reset Time
float32.tooltip: Damage timer is reset after this long of not damaging him from outside-range

rangef.name: Throttle Distance
rangef.tooltip: Throttle the tank from running (far) to walking (near) across this range of distances. (defaults to 5 and 3)

float32.name: Protect Damage Amount
float32.tooltip: Once current damage reaches this amount, protect your special parts until no recent damage

float32.name: Protect Time
float32.tooltip: How long should we protect our special parts for?

tagRef.name: Spew Infection Character
tagRef.tooltip: What character should I throw up all over my target? Carrots?

float32.name: Spew Chance
float32.tooltip: Probability of throwing up a bunch of infection forms when perimeterising

stringid.name: Spew Marker
stringid.tooltip: From whence should the infection forms cometh?

rangef.name: Spew Frequency
rangef.tooltip: Min/max time between spawning each infection form during spew. (defaults to 0.1 and 0.3)

float32.name: Stealth Morph Distance Threshold
float32.tooltip: Morphing inside this range causes a tank guy, outside this range causes a ranged fella

float32.name: Stealth Morph Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Percentage of body health he has to be taken down in order to cause a morph

rangef.name: Stalk Range
rangef.tooltip: We want to stalk our target within this range

float32.name: Stalk Range Hard Max
float32.tooltip: We will never be able to pick a firing position more than this far from our target

float32.name: Stalk Charge Chance
float32.tooltip: While stalking, charge randomly with this probability per second (also will charge when on periphery, this is just some spice)

float32.name: Ranged Proximity Distance
float32.tooltip: Morph to tank/stalker when someone gets this close to me as a ranged form

float32.name: Turtle Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: amount of damage necessary to trigger a turtle

rangef.name: Turtle Time
rangef.tooltip: when turtling, turtle for a random time with these bounds

float32.name: Turtle Distance
float32.tooltip: when I turtle I send out a stimulus to friends within this radius to also turtle

float32.name: Turtle Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: when my target get within this range, abort turtling

float32.name: Group Morph Range
float32.tooltip: Follow the morph of any other form within this distance

tagblock.name: Equipment Definitions
tagblock.comment: Create one of these for each equipment type that you would like a character to be able to use. If you specify a relative drop chance of greater than zero then the character will use and drop this type of equipment with that (relative) chance. If you leave the equipment field empty, then there will be that (relative) chance of using and dropping no equipment at all.

tagRef.name: Equipment
tagRef.tooltip: The equipment item that is to be usable

float32.name: Relative Drop Chance
float32.tooltip: The relative chance of this equipment being dropped with respect to the other pieces of equipment specified in this block

tagblock.name: Equipment Use

enum16.name: Use When
enum16.tooltip: When should we use this equipment?

enum16.name: Use How
enum16.tooltip: How should we use this equipment?

tagblock.comment: Given that we have decided to use this equipment, should we do so? (0= always use it, 1= never use it). Heroic skip fraction is the average of normal and legendary chances.

tagblock.name: Stimuli Responses
tagblock.comment: Here you can define a character tag which will be applied on top of this one when the named stimulus is present on a character.In the case of multiple stimulus with character tag responses being present, the first listed will be used.

float32.name: Pain Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the pain function. 0 defaults to 0.5

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Duration
float32.tooltip: The time it takes to fade out a damage region that is no longer the most recent damage region to be hit

float32.name: Pain Screen Region Fade Out Weight Threshold
float32.tooltip: The threshold weight below which the focus channel must fall before we can cross fade to another region.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Tolerance
degree.tooltip: The tolerance angle between next and previous damage directions, below which we randomly vary the ping direction.

degree.name: Pain Screen Angle Randomness
degree.tooltip: The maximum random angle to vary the incoming ping direction by if it's too close to the previous ping.

float32.name: Defensive Screen Duration
float32.tooltip: The duration of the defensive function. 0 defaults to 2.0

float32.name: Defensive Screen Scrub Fallback Fraction
float32.tooltip: When receiving multiple pings, this is the min percentage of the defensive screen scrub value will fallback to.
